title: Fragment, 6th–7th century
medium:
Medium: wool, linen
Technique: tapestry weave
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of Anonymous Donor
description: Tapestry medallion of very fine weave with blue and tan figures on a red ground. Two confronted horsemen flank a tree; they wear a green and blue tunic, respectively, and carry swords and shields rimmed with pearl bands and their cloaks stream out behind them. Above the horsemen, a pair of horizontal branches terminating in heart-shaped leaves support a pair of confronted animals, heads reversed. A human head in the field under each horseman. The inner border contains vegetal motifs, including heart-shaped flowers and trefoils. Inner and outer degraded "pearl" borders.

tombstone.epitaph:
Fragment, 6th–7th century.
6th–7th century. Medium: wool, linen
Technique: tapestry weave. Museum purchase through gift of Anonymous Donor. 1946-103-1.
